title.rendered: Some Guidance about Menopause from the Best Gynecologist in West Delhi

content.rendered:
Talking about menstruation is still a taboo in this country. Many girls have no knowledge about the different facts about menstruation. Even though there are a lot of mentions about the period and how to take precautions and all that, very few talk about menopause. We really don’t know why there are so many mentions about such an important topic. It is the responsibility of today’s generation to raise awareness about menopause and get the elder generation talking about it as well. Whenever you visit a gynecologist, make sure to ask them everything about menopause. Don’t shy away. Ask about menopause to the best gynecologist in West Delhi. Here are some general facts you need to know about menopause.

What is menopause?

Menopause marks the end of a woman’s menstrual cycle. It is the time when our periods stop and you cannot get pregnant anymore. During this time or just before menopause, a women’s body starts producing less hormones which include estrogen, progesterone. The time when these transitions occur in perimenopause that marks the onset of menopause. Perimenopause actually starts many years before a woman hits menopause. During this time the ovaries slowly begin to produce less estrogen. It lasts until you hit menopause, the time when the ovaries stop releasing eggs.

What is the normal age to hit menopause?

Perimenopause usually begins in a woman during her 30s-40s or even earlier. The average age when most women hits menopause is usually between 45-55 years. This age range can vary from person to person.

What are the symptoms of menopause?

According to experts and reports around the internet, there are usually 30-35 symptoms of menopause. These symptoms are very common and it determines when you are going to hit the end of your menstrual cycle. Some of the symptoms are :

Hot flashes:

This is the most common and visible symptom. As the hormonal levels of your body decreases, you tend to feel chilly and feverish which can spread in the entire body. It makes your face go red.

Irregular Periods:

This is the most common and visible symptom. As the hormonal levels of your body decreases, you tend to feel chilly and feverish which can spread in the entire body. It makes your face go red.

One might face irregular periods during her entire menstrual cycle. But, when menopause is going to come to the irregularity will become regular. It can cause heavier or lighter flow as well.

Vaginal Dryness:

  • aginal dryness can occur when the estrogen levels fall before and cause the natural moisture of the vagina to diminish. This effect can make natural lubrication difficult leaving many women in pain during sexual intercourse.

These are some symptoms of menopause. Other symptoms include fatigue, mood swings, night sweats, memory lapse, weight gain, etc.

What to do during this period?

Well, the symptoms may seem difficult to live with but you won’t face all these symptoms together. It is not that hard. Book an appointment to your gynecologist and clear all your doubts from them. They will guide you about menopause.

These are some general facts about menopause. In order to be safe and precautious visit the gynecologists in organ hospital. It is the best hospital in West Delhi and they treat patients with utmost care.
